pros: the school has a train station

review_title: The Grass is Green(er) When You Water It
pros: Terrific personnel. Most faculty work hard to provide high-quality instruction, genuine care and commitment to their students. Generally supportive administration. Outstanding growth potential.
cons: Administrative conduct does not always align with student, faculty and/or staff educational/professional interests. As with any large organization, rules become guidelines when necessary to suit the institution.

pros: Great coworkers and students, love the campus
cons: Its tough to get a raise other than cost of living

pros: Being able to earn an income.
cons: A very difficult place to work

pros: Nice union job with great benefits.
cons: No opportunity for promotion in the same department.

pros: My coworkers in the other departments were friendly.

review_title: No reward for expertise, publications, experience, evaluations, or loyalty.

pros: Being able to teach advanced classes because nobody else was qualified.

pros: learning experience with state of the art equipment

review_title: Overall a good place to work
pros: Healthy work environment for most departments
cons: The higher pay is given to people because of how long they been here and not what they contribute

cons: Not good for supporting yourself independently

pros: Gained a ton of real world experience.
cons: As it was a student worker position, the pay was so-so.

job_title: Assistant Strength and Conditioning Coach in Bridgewater, MA

pros: Small class size & nice students
cons: Heavy teaching load & relatively low salary

pros: A good place to work.
cons: Employees are not paid enough.

review_title: PAL Program Tutor - Good student job to consider
pros: There are many different classes you can become a PAL for, and it will look good on a resume. Each class comes with various flexible times to work, but this depends on the department you apply for. It doesn't require a ton of time out of your week, and helps sharpen concepts you've already learned.
cons: The pay isn't a whole lot, and I personally made the decision to pick up a second job - this came in handy when they cut everyone by one hour per week. It was also kind-of hard to make it to the various training sessions, and the alternative assignments just felt like busywork.

review_title: Great benefits, hard to move up if you don't know people
pros: It's a state union job.  That means as long as Massachusetts is doing well you'll get COLA raises pretty much every year.  And plenty of benefits.  Pay is pretty good to start but goes up slow.  Pressure of the job is low; not too deadline driven.
cons: A lot of nepotism and cronyism (sic), at least in the current administration.  Lots of coworkers who are just working out the string and don't care about their work.

pros: Generous internal grant support for both research and teaching. The university is interested in retaining and developing the full-time faculty so individuals are typically hired with an anticipation that they will be successfully tenured. Union is supportive of faculty members, good benefits.
cons: Typical university administrative bloat. Seems like a new VP of blah blah blah is hired every month. If you want to be a faculty member, this is a great place. If you want to move up into administration... have fun dealing with the usual bureaucratic BS.

pros: Bridgewater State College is a great place to work.  There is a great sense of community and pride.  There are many many different departments throughout the campus so there is a lot of room for growth.
cons: BSC is obviously a state college.  Because of this there are more rule, regulations and guidelines than at a private school.  With that being said, it is a great environment to work and it is fair.

pros: Good job, free CDL and paid training, pick your own work schedule, opportunities to take on extra work (voluntary) at higher pay rate on most occasions. Most people in FMP are nice and enjoyable people to work with.
cons: Not just within FMP but many departments are very black and white, resistant to change, etc. Where I work, student managers have too much authority. Very understaffed, but then again it is a state university.

review_title: A bit confused in forward thinking and moving toward technology
pros: Beautiful location with a small intimate victorian type setting.  Generally people seem nice - in a "town" kind of way.
cons: Although they say they are looking to move toward the future, without expertise in this area, they have been stabbing blind and aren't quite sure what best practices are.  This doesn't make them bad - it makes them....painfully underprepared.

review_title: Adjunct teaching is a tough career period, but BSC is a good place to do it.
pros: Friendly, easy-going environment. Students are both polite and interested in learning. Colleagues are very friendly and supportive. Bridgewater is a lovely college town.
cons: BSC is suffering from the same pressures as the rest of higher education. Low salaries and no benefits for adjunct teachers is standard for the industry.

job_title: Institute Programming Assistant in Bridgewater, MA
pros: Amazing leadership, flexible hours, independent work, great atmosphere.  Working here provided me with several skills that helped me further my career and successfully complete graduate school.  I felt extremely comfortable working at this University.
cons: Seeing as I was a student employee at the time the pay was very little.  However, what lacked in pay made up for in experience.

pros: They paid well, it was extremely rewarding in order to help one and kept me current on old material.
cons: Some of the students who came in for help were entirely awful. They would cry incessantly and yell at you because you weren't helping them. They were just unwilling to learn.

pros: strong emphasis and support for dynamic teaching; small class sizes are common; many internal grants for scholarship and travel to facutly; progressive and innovative upper administration supports new ideas
cons: many individuals in all levels of administrative roles throughout the university act in a manner that enables personal prejudices and opinions of other facutly and staff to impede productive work or student success; insufficient or missing leadership training provided to administrators across the campus at all levels

pros: Great experience with working in teams and exposure to many different elements of the working world while balancing school work. Great exposure to leadership training and self development. Overall great experience and you get the opportunity to make a positive impact on many peoples lives.
cons: Programming, training and many other parts of the job get painfully repetitive, you must be creative and have a good mindset to keep the position fulfilling

pros: Better pay for a VL or adjunct than a lot of other places in the area.
cons: Like the other places retention is more important to the admin than a quality education. Just like other colleges, they are more interested in pushing the PC agenda and how students feel than actually learning the material they are supposed to.

pros: Everyone was extremely helpful, and taught me skill sets outside my job description to prepare me for the job I wanted in the future.
cons: While I was there, the upper management was having issues with the workers. There was miscommunication and a power struggle. From what I've heard, whatever issues they had have been solved.

review_title: Once A Bear Always A Bear!
pros:
Professional staff are friendly
Environment is clean
cons:
Parking if you are not part of the professional staff can be a bit hectic
Some offices are smaller than others and thus there's less money going in for if they need a summer worker or any other professional staff.

job_title: Student Event Planner in Bridgewater, MA
pros: The Conference and Event Services office has a great staff who cares about student workers' success! Very flexible and accommodating to student schedules.
cons: When I worked for CESO, the staff was spread out across the campus instead of being in one central location. I believe that has changed since I graduated.

job_title: Academic Counselor- Graduate Assistant in Plymouth, MA
pros: Bridgewater State University has a great atmosphere to work in. My co-workers are wonderful and everyone works as a team towards one goal, student success.
cons: The location of Bridgewater State University's Academic Achievement Center is located on the bottom floor of the library with no windows and bad lighting.

pros: Very nice place to work.  Nice people everywhere.  Great benefits.  Students are great to work with.  would definitely recommend working here.
cons: upper administration seems  out of touch with staff.  More concerned with keeping faculty happy than staff that run the school.

pros: Flexible hours, you could pick up several blocks or only do a couple hours per week. Helped you stay fresh on your own work while helping others.
cons: Really odd and cumbersome way of submitting time sheets that lead to some tutors frequently missing out on their pay for a period altogether.

great friends and people

pros: The atmosphere is great! Friendly staff and student body. It a wonderful place to work. I was a student employee so it was 20 hours a week so enjoyable.
cons: I really don't have any thing bad to say honestly!
